KPI_noPeopleVolunteering.name: People volunteering their time
KPI_noPeopleVolunteering.definition: Number of people volunteering their time: People that have volunteered at least four hours during the annual reporting period.

KPI_noPaidStaff.name: Paid staff
KPI_noPaidStaff.definition: Number of paid staff: People who work with a National Society or the Secretariat for a minimum of three months and are remunerated.

KPI_noPeopleDonatingBlood.name: People donating blood
KPI_noPeopleDonatingBlood.definition: Number of people donating blood: People that have donated blood at least once during the reporting period.

KPI_noLocalUnits.name: Local units
KPI_noLocalUnits.definition: Number of local units: National Society subdivisions that work directly with the community – this can include local chapters, branches, regional and intermediate offices, and headquarters.

KPI_IncomeLC (CHF).name: Income (in CHF)
KPI_IncomeLC (CHF).definition: Total income received: the fiscal value of money, material goods, and services a National Society receives during the fiscal year (in CHF).

KPI_expenditureLC (CHF).name: Expenditure (in CHF)
KPI_expenditureLC (CHF).definition: Total expenditure: the fiscal value of money, material goods, and services a National Society spends during the fiscal year (in CHF).

KPI_noPeopleReachedDisaster.name: People reached by disaster response and early recovery programmes
KPI_noPeopleReachedDisaster: People reached by disaster response and early recovery programmes

KPI_noPeopleReachedAllServices.name: People reached by Long Term Services and Development Programmes
KPI_noPeopleReachedAllServices.definition: Number of people reached by Long Term Services and Development Programmes: Direct and indirect recipients and people covered by Federation services counted, disaggregated by service areas.
KPI_noPeopleReachedAllServices: People reached by long term services and development programmes

KPI_noPeopleCoveredPreparedness.name: People covered
KPI_noPeopleCoveredPreparedness.definition: Number of people covered by Preparedness and Risk Reduction Programmes
KPI_noPeopleCoveredPreparedness: People covered by preparedness and risk reduction programmes

Population.name: Population, total
Population.definition: Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.
Population.source: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Report (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.

Poverty.name: National poverty headcount ratio
Poverty.definition: National poverty headcount ratio is the percentage of the population living below the national poverty lines. National estimates are based on population-weighted subgroup estimates from household surveys.
Poverty.source: World Bank, Global Poverty Working Group. Data are compiled from official government sources or are computed by World Bank staff using national (i.e. country–specific) poverty lines.

GDP.name: GDP (current US$)
GDP.definition: GDP at purchaser's prices is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in current U.S. dollars. Dollar figures for GDP are converted from domestic currencies using single year official exchange rates. For a few countries where the official exchange rate does not reflect the rate effectively applied to actual foreign exchange transactions, an alternative conversion factor is used.
GDP.source: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.
